description:
Demolition of buildings and redevelopment of land and buildings to provide a new building to comprise residential accommodation (Class C3 293 units) and new educational and performance space for the Guildhall School of Music & Drama with ancillary plant and servicing and associated and ancillary uses (Class D1 14,960sq metres); new retail floorspace (Class A1, A3 79sq meters); works to the pedestrian walkway, works of hard and soft landscaping, alterations to existing vehicular and pedestrian access and highway layout together with other associated and enabling works.

The proposal involves a departure from one or more policies of the development plan in force in the area.

The application involves the discontinuance of a City Walkway and stair on the site and the bridge over Silk Street and Moor Lane linking Speed House, Milton Court and City Point.
decision_conditions:
The London Borough of Islington wish to object to the proposed development for the following reasons:

The tower is far too high and will have a harmful impact on the views from Finsbury Square, Bunhill Fields, HAC fields and is likely to also have a significant impact on other near, medium and long views from areas within the London Borough Of Islington. 

LBI have an application for Ropemaker Place and great care has been taken to ensure views of St Paul's are not impinged, including backdrops, and the same care should be taken with the Milton Court redevelopment.

While there is no objection raised to the podium block, which would house the Guildhall School of Music and Drama, the overall proposal is at an unacceptable scale and would result in paving the way for an undesirable cluster of super-tall buildings in this part of London.
ward:
Within City (near Bunhill Ward)
